clinical_study.official_title: Myorelaxation Practice in Paediatric Anesthesia: Retrospective Study

collaborator.agency: Faculty of medicine, Masaryk University Brno

brief_summary.textblock: In retrospective data search the investigators will identified the percentage of patients with muscle relaxants administered during perioperative period. The block reversal, typ of drug, percentage of cases with and without reversal will be identified.

detailed_description.textblock: The actual percentage of surgeries with the muscle relaxants administered during perioperative period in paediatric patients remain unclear because many surgeries are being performed without muscle relaxation. In this retrospective study, the anesthesiology perioperative data from January 2016 till December 2016 in the tertiary center od Pediatric anesthesia will be searched for the percentage of surgeries with muscle relaxants administered. Type of surgery, age, weight, duration u surgery, muscle relaxants drug and percentage of block reversal will be identified.

primary_outcome.description: The actual percentage of paediatric patients with perioperative neuromuscular blockade with active pharmacology block reversal at the end of surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of surgeries without muscle relaxant administration
secondary_outcome.description: Paediatric surgeries without neuromuscular blocking agent administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Type of neuromuscular blocking agent in paediatric anesthesiology practice
secondary_outcome.description: Actual type of neuromuscular blocking agent used in paediatric anesthesiology practice in predefined period.

arm_group.description: Neuromuscular blocking agent administrated during surgery to the paediatric patient

intervention.description: Administration of neuromuscular blockers during anesthesia

study_pop.textblock: Paediatric anesthesiology patients who underwent surgery with neuromuscular blocking agent administered during surgery in tertiary center paediatric anesthesiology department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- paediatric patients
- the study period (1/2016-12/2016)
- neuromuscular blocking agent administration during surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- surgery without neuromuscular blockade
